overview: The final version of the measure, HB70 CD1, requires condominium association budget summaries to contain all necessary information without referring to other documents and clarifies a unit owner's ability to enforce compliance (HB70_CD1). The Conference Committee has amended the bill by deleting the controversial provision that would have shifted the burden of proof to the association in compliance disputes (HB70_CD1_CCR43_). The bill now awaits final passage in its amended form.
economic_impact: The final version of the bill has removed the provision that shifted the burden of proof to condominium associations (HB70_CD1_CCR43_). This change mitigates the economic concerns raised in previous testimony regarding potential increases in litigation costs and insurance premiums for associations. By deleting this language, the measure no longer incentivizes what opponents feared would be frivolous lawsuits.
policy_impact: The key policy change in the bill's final version is the removal of language that would have placed the burden of proving compliance on the condominium association (HB70_CD1_CCR43_). This amendment by the Conference Committee represents a significant reversal from the previous draft, addressing the primary point of contention from stakeholders. The bill now clarifies a unit owner's standing to bring an action for an injunction without altering the standard legal burden of proof (HB70_CD1).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The most significant update is the Conference Committee's removal of the provision that shifted the burden of proving compliance onto the condominium association (HB70_CD1_CCR43_). This amendment directly addresses and resolves the central controversy highlighted in the previous fiscal note, particularly the concerns about increased litigation and insurance costs. The final bill, HB70 CD1, now focuses on budget summary clarity and a unit owner's standing to enforce compliance without altering the standard burden of proof (HB70_CD1).
